info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 3:52PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTY THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 352 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near La Cienega, or 10 miles southwest of Santa Fe, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Santa Fe, Eldorado At Santa Fe, Cerrillos Hills State Park, Canada De Los Alamos, La Cienega, Los Cerrillos and Lamy. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 267 and 283, and between Mile Markers 285 and 295. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 285 and 290. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
